Opcode.name: PCM_OP_CUST_UPDATE_CUSTOMER
Opcode.Doc: The opcode PCM_OP_CUST_UPDATE_CUSTOMER can be used to update the customer information. The input data is partitioned in logical buckets namely account information, contact information, balance groups, bill units, payment methods, locale, profiles and topup details.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: This is the account poid, used for opening transaction if required.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_ACCOUNT_OBJ
Poid.Doc: This is the poid of the account which needs to be updated.

String.name: PIN_FLD_PROGRAM_NAME
String.Doc: The program name identifies calling program.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_VERSION
Int.Doc: The version flag indicates if the flist confers to the current specification or legacy specification. The values could be PIN_PORTAL_VERSION_CURRENT or PIN_PORTAL_VERSION_LEGACY. If legacy is specified a conversion function will be invoked. Default is legacy.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_NAMEINFO
Array.Doc: This represents name and address information. The element-id of the element defines the contact type for some predefined values. The element-id of 1 indicates Billing Contact. Other values are undefined, and the contact_type string describes the type of contact.

String.name: PIN_FLD_CONTACT_TYPE
String.Doc: Contact type comment for this person (for undefined element-ids).

String.name: PIN_FLD_GEOCODE
String.Doc: Geocode of the address used for taxation(for billing address).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PHONES
Array.Doc: Phone array.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Phone Type. The possible values are unknown(0),home(1), work(2), fax(3), pager(4), portable(5), POP(6) and Support(7).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_ACCTINFO
Array.Doc: The information to be stored in the account object will be passed in the acctinfo.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The account POID.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO
Array.Doc: Account level balance group indicator. Here the array does not contain anything but the element-id is significant. This indicates the balance group element in the input that needs to be associated at the account level.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_GRP_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The balance group object for the account. Either PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO or PIN_FLD_BAL_GRP_OBJ must be specified. If PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO is passed in, this field will be ignored.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_ACTG_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Accounting type of the billinfo. This field is moved under PIN_FLD_BILLINFO array. If this field is still passed under PIN_FLD_ACCTINFO array, it will be copied to all PIN_FLD_BILLINFO arrays and dropped from ACCTINFO. This backward compatibility support is provided only if PIN_FLD_VERSION is legacy. If PIN_FLD_BILLINFO already defines this field, the value passed here is ignored and dropped.

Values.Doc: This represents "open items" type of accounting. With open item accounting customer's bill does not include amounts from previous bill, if not paid(PIN_ACTG_TYPE_OPEN_ITEMS).
This represents "balance forward" type of accounting. With balance forward accounting customer's bill will include amounts from previous bill, if not paid (PIN_ACTG_TYPE_BALANCE_FORWARD).

String.name: PIN_FLD_GL_SEGMENT
String.Doc: Account's General Ledger segment. Used in G/L reporting.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CURRENCY
Int.Doc: The primary currency of the account. Also this acts as element-id of primary balance element for accounting roll-up. If not provided the default account currency information will be read from CM's pin.conf.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CURRENCY_SECONDARY
Int.Doc: The secondary currency of the account. Also this acts as element-id of secondary balance element for accounting roll-up.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_ACCOUNT_TYPE
Enum.Doc: This represents the type of account. This can be either a brand account or a standard account.

String.name: PIN_FLD_CUSTOMER_SEGMENT_LIST
String.Doc: Customer Segment List - a string list of customer segments separated by '|'. Example: For segments 1, 4, 6 the string is "1|4|6".

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_ACCESS
String.Doc: Client identification fields. Access method - admin, meccad, etc.

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_SOURCE
String.Doc: Source address - ANI, X121, IP addr, etc.

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_VENDOR
String.Doc: ID String for client software vendor.

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_PROMO_CODE
String.Doc: Promotional code for client package - generally set by vendor.

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_SERIAL_NUM
String.Doc: Serial number for specific copy of client.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: This field represents the timestamp at which the event ends. Effective time of the update to this account, on an external system. If this field is not specified, then current time on the BRM server will be considered.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: This would be the timestamp to be used to generate events. If not specified, the current time on the BRM server will be considered.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO
Array.Doc: The Balance Group array. List of balance groups that need to be created or updated.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The partial poid of the balance group to be created. During monitor creation/update, Poid type of /balance_group/monitor is used. To modify an existing balance group, specify the full POID.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO
Array.Doc: The billinfo array element. Here the contents are not significant. The element id will determine the billinfo in the input that will be associated with this balance group. if not specified then the first billinfo that the system finds will be associated with this balance group.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The POID of Billinfo that this balance group will be associated with. The fields PIN_FLD_BILLINFO and PIN_FLD_BILLINFO_OBJ are mutually exclusive. If PIN_FLD_BILLINFO is available then PIN_FLD_BILLINFO_OBJ will be ignored.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_LIMIT
Array.Doc: This an optional array to set the credit limit parameters. The element id is significant and indicates the resource id for which the limit is being set.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CREDIT_LIMIT
Decimal.Doc: Limit for this resource. Current balance cannot exceed this limit unless affected by a limit override rate or manually adjusted by a CSR.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CREDIT_FLOOR
Decimal.Doc: Baseline for calculating percentage for threshold triggers. Credit limit minus credit floor is 100% of measured range. Credit floor does NOT enforce any limit on current balance.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CREDIT_THRESHOLDS
Int.Doc: Bit flags for triggering when resource balance crosses a boundary when increasing in value.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_THRESHOLDS
Array.Doc: Array of fixed threshold values.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_THRESHOLD
Int.Doc: Fixed threshold value.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_AMOUNT
Decimal.Doc: Fixed threshold value in Decimal data type

Array.name: PIN_FLD_RULES
Array.Doc: This is an optional array to set the consumption rules for a resource. The element id is significant and indicates a resource id for which the limit as well as consumption rules are set.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_CONSUMPTION_RULE
Enum.Doc: Consumption rule to be applied on the resource.

Values.Doc: The consumption rule is not defined (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_NOT_DEFINED).
Earliest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest validity start time (earliest valid_from) first. (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_EST)
Latest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest validity start time (latest valid_from) first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LST).
Earliest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance that expires first (earliest valid_to.) (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_EET)
Latest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance that expires last (latest valid_to.) (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LET)

Earliest start time and latest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest valid_from first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_from, consume the one with the latest valid_to first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_ESTLET).

Earliest start time and earliest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest valid_from first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_from, consume the one with the earliest valid_to first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_ESTEET).

Latest start time and earliest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest sub-balance first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_from, consume the one with the earliest expired sub-balance first(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LSTEET).

Latest start time and latest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest valid_from first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_from, consume the one with the latest valid_to first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LSTLET).

Earliest expiration time and earliest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest valid_to first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_to, consume the one with the earliest valid_from first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_EETEST).

Earliest expiration time and latest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest valid_to first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_to, consume the one with the latest valid_from first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_EETLST).

Latest expiration time and earliest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest valid_to first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_to, use the one with the earliest valid_from first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LETEST).

Latest expiration time and latest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest valid_to first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_to, use the one with the latest valid_from first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LETLST).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO
Array.Doc: This represents the array of Billing info's. The element id is significant as it behaves as a key, in other objects like balance groups (bal_info array) to be created during this operation, to identify which billinfo element to associate with.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The type only billinfo poid to create the billinfo. To update the existing billinfo, specify the complete billinfo poid.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BUSINESS_PROFILE_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Business profile poid. Pointer to the Business profile poid to which this billinfo belongs.

String.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO_ID
String.Doc: This field identifies the billinfo by name.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PAYINFO
Array.Doc: The Payinfo array. The element-id is significant, but not the contents. The element-id will be used to identify which payinfo array to use from the input. If it is not present then the payment method is considered either as transient or voucher.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PAYINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The payinfo poid that this billinfo is associated with. If PIN_FLD_PAYINFO is specified, this field will be ignored.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO
Array.Doc: The balance group info array. The element-id is significant, but not the contents. The element-id will be used to identify which balance group array to use from the input. If it is not present and this is a new billinfo to be created, a default balance group will be created for the billinfo.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_GRP_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The balance group that this billinfo is associated with. If PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO is specified, this field will be ignored.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_PAY_TYPE
Enum.Doc: This represents the type of billing for user.

Values.Doc: Indicates charge roll up to parent account (PIN_PAY_TYPE_SUBORD).

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PARENT_FLAGS
Int.Doc: This field indicates if this billinfo has subordinates or not. The value of 0 indicates that it does not have subordinates and the value of 1 indicates that it has subordinates.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_BILL_WHEN
Int.Doc: Anniversary billing slot.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_ACTG_FUTURE_DOM
Int.Doc: New Accounting Close day-of-month (1-31).

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_ACTG_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Accounting type of the billinfo. Possible values are PIN_ACTG_TYPE_OPEN_ITEMS(1) and PIN_ACTG_TYPE_BALANCE_FORWARD(2).This field is used to allocate items for payment. If not specified, the configuration entry actg_type is read from pin.conf of CM. If CM's pin.conf does not have actg_type entry active, then default accounting type will be balance forward type.

Values.Doc: This represents "open items" type of accounting. With open item accounting customer's bill does not include amounts from previous bill, if not paid(PIN_ACTG_TYPE_OPEN_ITEMS).
This represents "balance forward" type of accounting. With balance forward accounting customer's bill will include amounts from previous bill, if not paid(PIN_ACTG_TYPE_BALANCE_FORWARD).

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_BILLING_STATUS
Enum.Doc: Indicates whether the billinfo should be billed or it should be suspended for billing.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_BILLING_STATUS_FLAGS
Int.Doc: Indicates a reason for setting of the given billing status.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS
Enum.Doc: Status of the billinfo: active, inactive, or closed.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS_FLAGS
Int.Doc: Indicates a reason for setting of the given status.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_SPONSOR_FLAGS
Int.Doc: It indicates whether this billinfo has a sponsoree.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_SPONSOREE_FLAGS
Int.Doc: It indicates whether this billinfo has a sponsor.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_AR_BILLINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: It indicates the AR billinfo for the given billinfo. It can be present only for a subodinate billinfo.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PARENT_BILLINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: It indicates the immediate (one level up) parent. Note that the given billinfo is not necessary a subordinate. The parent field may reflect just child-parent relation It should be mandatory if moving to the new parent.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CURRENCY
Int.Doc: During account creation these values will be derived from the account. In future when an account can have multiple currencies, the value specified here will be used.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CURRENCY_SECONDARY
Int.Doc: During account creation these values will be derived from the account. In future when an account can have multiple currencies, the value specified here will be used.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_BILLING_SEGMENT
Enum.Doc: It indicates the Billing Segment.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PAYINFO
Array.Doc: This is an array of payment methods to be associated with this account.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The partial poid of payinfo to be created. In case of an update to an existing payinfo, specifiy the actual payinfo poid.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_PAY_TYPE
Enum.Doc: This represents the type of billing for user.

Values.Doc: Indicates charge roll up to parent account (PIN_PAY_TYPE_SUBORD).

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_PAYMENT_TERM
Enum.Doc: Payment term ID defines which payment term will be used in the payment due date calculation.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PAYMENT_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Payment Offset.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_INV_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Indicates the type of invoice to be generated.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_FLAGS
Int.Doc: Partial Flag. This enables the opcode to treat some fields from the input flist as optional. Values are (0) mandatory, or (1) optional. The fields affected are: PIN_FLD_DEBIT_NUM, PIN_FLD_DEBIT_EXP, PIN_FLD_BANK_NO, PIN_FLD_CITY, PIN_FLD_STATE, PIN_FLD_ZIP and PIN_FLD_COUNTRY.

Substruct.name: PIN_FLD_INHERITED_INFO
Substruct.Doc: All subclass fields for the payinfo object are included in this substruct. The subclass depends on the pay_type. If pay_type is invoice then this array element will have PIN_FLD_INV_INFO, etc.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_INV_INFO
Array.Doc: This array element has fields related to invoice type of payment method. There will be only one element and element id is not significant.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_DELIVERY_PREFER
Enum.Doc: Prefered delivery method email(0), postal(1) and fax(3).

String.name: PIN_FLD_INV_INSTR
String.Doc: Comments to appear on each invoice.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_INV_TERMS
Enum.Doc: Used for invoice terms to be printed on the invoice.

String.name: PIN_FLD_EMAIL_ADDR
String.Doc: Email address to which invoice be delivered.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: Name of party responsible for payment.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_CC_INFO
Array.Doc: This array element has fields related to credit card type of payment method. There will be only one element and element id is not significant.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: Name as it appears on the credit card.

String.name: PIN_FLD_SECURITY_ID
String.Doc: Security ID. Used for credit card fraud prevention. This field stores the 3 digit CVV2 for Visa and 4 digit CID for amex.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_DD_INFO
Array.Doc: This array element has fields related to direct debit type of payment method. There will be only one element and element id is not significant.

String.name: PIN_FLD_BANK_NO
String.Doc: RDFI/Bank ID used for routing transactions.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: Name as it appears on the card.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Bank account type- Checking(1), savings(2) or corporate(3).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_SEPA_INFO
Array.Doc: This array element has fields related to SEPA type of payment method. There will be only one element and element id is not significant.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Mandate type whether it is one-off or recurring.

String.name: PIN_FLD_IBAN
String.Doc: International Bank Account Number which is a unique identifier for the bank account.

String.name: PIN_FLD_BIC
String.Doc: Bank Identifier Code which is a unique identifier for the bank related to the account.

String.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_CONTRACT_ID
String.Doc: ID of the underlying contract between the debtor and the creditor.

String.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_CONTRACT_DESCR
String.Doc: Description of the underlying contract between the debtor and the creditor.

String.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_UNIQUE_REFERENCE
String.Doc: A unique reference number for the mandate.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_SIGNED_T
Timestamp.Doc: Date when the mandate is signed. This cannot be before the account creation date or a future date.

String.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_SIGNED_PLACE
String.Doc: Place where the mandate is signed.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_DEBTOR_INFO
Array.Doc: Array to store SEPA compliant customer's bank account details.

String.name: PIN_FLD_REF_PARTY
String.Doc: Name of the Debtor Reference Party.

String.name: PIN_FLD_REF_PARTY_ID_CODE
String.Doc: Identification code of the Debtor Reference Party.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_LOCALES
Array.Doc: The locale information. There can only be one element in this array. The element id must be 1.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PROFILES
Array.Doc: This represents Profile array to be associated with the account.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PROFILE_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Partial poid of profile object to create. The 'type' and 'database' sub-fields are used in the creation. The other sub-fields are ignored. In case of modification to an existing profile, specify the actual poid of the profile.

Any.name: PIN_FLD_INHERITED
Any.Doc: This container is used to specify any fields for the profile.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_TOPUP_INFO
Array.Doc: Topup array.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: Topup poid. This will be type-only for creation.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_ACCOUNT_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Account poid.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PARENT
Poid.Doc: Parent's account poid. This field is mandatory in case of sponsored topup.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PAYINFO
Array.Doc: The element-id is significant. Contents are not significant. The element id points to the payinfo array element in the input flist to be used for top-up.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PAYINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The payinfo object that this topup is associated with. If PIN_FLD_PAYINFO is passed in, this field will be ignored. If PIN_FLD_PAYINFO is not passed in, this becomes a mandatory field.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO
Array.Doc: The element-id is significant. Contents are not significant. The element id points to the billinfo array element in the input flist to be used for top-up.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The POID of Billinfo that this topup is associated with. If PIN_FLD_BILLINFO is passed in, this field will be ignored. If PIN_FLD_BILLINFO is not passed in, this becomes a mandatory field.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_TOPUP_AMT
Decimal.Doc: This represents Topup amount. In case of auto-topups this will indicate the amount to topup with.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_TOPUP_CAP
Decimal.Doc: Topup cap indicates the max topup that can be done for a given cycle. The cycle is driven by the cycle information set-up in the billinfo. A values of 0 means no cap.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_TOPPED_AMT
Decimal.Doc: This indicates the total topped up amount during the given cycle. This amount will be populated only if the cap is set.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_LAST_TOPUP_T
Timestamp.Doc: This indicates the when the last topup happened.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_GROUP_TOPUP_INFO
Array.Doc: The field represents sponsored topup. The array contains fields related to Sponsored topup only.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The /group/topup poid. Poid of sponsored topup group involved in the creation/modification of member account. If the object instance exists, the poid is complete poid with valid poid number. If no object instance exists, the poid is type only poid.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PARENT
Poid.Doc: Parent's account poid. This field is mandatory in case of sponsored topup.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: The Name of the /group/topup. This helps to identify the group.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_GRP_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Balance Group of the parent/payer of the /group/topup.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_GROUP_TOPUP_LIMITS
Array.Doc: Represents /group/topup financial properties per resource id.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_RESOURCE_ID
Int.Doc: Resource id of topup operation.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_TOPUP_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Topup amount is used in automatic sponsored topup.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_TOPUP_CAP
Decimal.Doc: Topup cap is used as a maximum limit of topup for particular topup group during cycle.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_GROUP_TOPUP_MEMBERS
Array.Doc: Represents members' properties of the /group/topup.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO
Array.Doc: The member's topup balance group indicator. Here the array does not contain anything but the element id is significant. It indicates which balance group element in the input is for topup level.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_GRP_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Balance Group of a member of the /group/topup. If in this array, PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO is not passed in, this field becomes mandatory. If PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO is passed in, this field will be ignored.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_TOPUP_INTERVAL
Int.Doc: This indicates the interval at which automatic sponsored topup occur.

String.name: PIN_FLD_PIN
String.Doc: The PIN which will be used for authentication during Ad-Hoc topup.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS
Enum.Doc: The status of the member (active/inactive/closed).

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: Account object passed into call.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_ACCTINFO
Array.Doc: The information to be stored in the account object will be passed in the acctinfo.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The account POID.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO
Array.Doc: Account level balance group indicator. Here the array does not contain anything but the element-id is significant. It indicates which balance group element in the input is account level. It is recommended to pass in the PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO. If not passed then a default balance group will be created.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_GRP_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The balance group object for the account. Either PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO or PIN_FLD_BAL_GRP_OBJ must be specified. If PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO is passed in, this field will be ignored.

String.name: PIN_FLD_GL_SEGMENT
String.Doc: Account's General Ledger segment. Used in G/L reporting.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CURRENCY
Int.Doc: The primary currency of the account. Also this acts as element-id of primary balance element for accounting roll-up. If not provided the default account currency information will be read from CM's pin.conf.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CURRENCY_SECONDARY
Int.Doc: The secondary currency of the account. Also this acts as element-id of secondary balance element for accounting roll-up.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_ACCOUNT_TYPE
Enum.Doc: This represents the type of account. This can be either a brand account or a standard account.

String.name: PIN_FLD_CUSTOMER_SEGMENT_LIST
String.Doc: Customer Segment List - a string list of customer segments separated by '|'. Example: For segments 1, 4, 6 the string is "1|4|6".

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_ACCESS
String.Doc: Client identification fields. Access method - admin, meccad, etc.

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_SOURCE
String.Doc: Source address - ANI, X121, IP addr, etc.

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_VENDOR
String.Doc: ID String for client software vendor.

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_PROMO_CODE
String.Doc: Promotional code for client package - generally set by vendor.

String.name: PIN_FLD_AAC_SERIAL_NUM
String.Doc: Serial number for specific copy of client.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO
Array.Doc: The Balance Group array. List of balance groups that was to be created or updated in this operation.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The balance group POID.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The POID of Billinfo that this balance group is associated with.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_ACCOUNT_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The account object that this bal-info is associated with.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_SERVICE_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The service object that this bal-info is associated with.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_LIMIT
Array.Doc: This an optional array to set the credit limit parameters. The element id is significant and indicates the resource id for which the limit is being set.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CREDIT_LIMIT
Decimal.Doc: Limit for this resource. Current balance cannot exceed this limit unless affected by a limit override rate or manually adjusted by a CSR.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CREDIT_FLOOR
Decimal.Doc: Baseline for calculating percentage for threshold triggers. Credit limit minus credit floor is 100% of measured range. Credit floor does NOT enforce any limit on current balance.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CREDIT_THRESHOLDS
Int.Doc: Bit flags for triggering when resource balance crosses a boundary when increasing in value.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_THRESHOLDS
Array.Doc: Array of fixed threshold values.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_THRESHOLD
Int.Doc: Fixed threshold value.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_RULES
Array.Doc: This is an optional array to set the consumption rules for a resource. The element id is significant and indicates a resource id for which the limit as well as consumption rules are set.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_CONSUMPTION_RULE
Enum.Doc: Consumption rule to be applied on the resource.

Values.Doc: The consumption rule is not defined (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_UNDEFINED).
Earliest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest validity start time (earliest valid_from) first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_EST).
Latest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest validity start time (latest valid_from) first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LST).
Earliest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance that expires first (earliest valid_to) (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_EET).
Latest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance that expires last (latest valid_to.) (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LET)

Earliest start time and latest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest valid_from first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_from, consume the one with the latest valid_to first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_ESTLET).

Earliest start time and earliest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest valid_from first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_from, consume the one with the earliest valid_to first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_ESTEET).

Latest start time and earliest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest sub-balance first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_from, consume the one with the earliest expired sub-balance first(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LSTEET).

Latest start time and latest expiration time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest valid_from first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_from, consume the one with the latest valid_to first. (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LSTLET)

Earliest expiration time and earliest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest valid_to first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_to, consume the one with the earliest valid_from first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_EETEST).

Earliest expiration time and latest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the earliest valid_to first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_to, consume the one with the latest valid_from first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_EETLST).

Latest expiration time and earliest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest valid_to first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_to, use the one with the earliest valid_from first (PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LETEST).

Latest expiration time and latest start time. Consume the sub-balance with the latest valid_to first. If more than one sub-balances has the same valid_to, use the one with the latest valid_from first(PIN_CONSUMPTION_RULE_LETLST).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_NAMEINFO
Array.Doc: This represents name and address information. The element-id of the element defines the contact type for some predefined values. The element id of 1 indicates Billing Contact. Other values are undefined, and the contact_type string describes the type of contact.

String.name: PIN_FLD_CONTACT_TYPE
String.Doc: Contact type comment for this person (for undefined element-ids).

String.name: PIN_FLD_GEOCODE
String.Doc: Geocode of the address used for taxation(for billing address).

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_TAXPKG_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Tax Engine used for the Geocode

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PHONES
Array.Doc: Phone array.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Phone Type. The possible values are unknown(0),home(1), work(2), fax(3), pager(4), portable(5), POP(6), Support(7).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PAYINFO
Array.Doc: Array of payment methods associated with this account.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The POID of the payinfo object created or updated.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_PAY_TYPE
Enum.Doc: This represents the type of billing for user.

Values.Doc: Indicates charge roll up to parent account (PIN_PAY_TYPE_SUBORD).

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_PAYMENT_TERM
Enum.Doc: Payment term ID defines which payment term will be used in the payment due date calculation.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PAYMENT_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Payment Offset

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_INV_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Indicates the type of invoice to be generated.

Substruct.name: PIN_FLD_INHERITED_INFO
Substruct.Doc: All subclass fields for the payinfo object are included in this substruct. The subclass depends on the pay_type. If pay_type is invoice then this array element will have PIN_FLD_INV_INFO, etc.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_INV_INFO
Array.Doc: This array element has fields related to invoice type of payment method. There will be only one element and element id is not significant.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_DELIVERY_PREFER
Enum.Doc: Prefered delivery method email(0), postal(1) and fax(3).

String.name: PIN_FLD_INV_INSTR
String.Doc: Comments to appear on each invoice.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_INV_TERMS
Enum.Doc: Used for invoice terms to be printed on the invoice.

String.name: PIN_FLD_EMAIL_ADDR
String.Doc: Email address to which invoice be delivered.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: Name of the party responsible for payment.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_CC_INFO
Array.Doc: This array element has fields related to credit card type of payment method. There will be only one element and element id is not significant.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: Name as it appears on the credit card.

String.name: PIN_FLD_SECURITY_ID
String.Doc: Security ID. Used for credit card fraud prevention. This field stores the 3 digit CVV2 for Visa and 4 digit CID for amex.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_DD_INFO
Array.Doc: This array element has fields related to direct debit type of payment method. There will be only one element and element id is not significant.

String.name: PIN_FLD_BANK_NO
String.Doc: RDFI/Bank ID used for routing transactions.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: Name as it appears on the card.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Bank account type. Checking(1), savings(2) or corporate(3).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_SEPA_INFO
Array.Doc: This array element has fields related to SEPA type of payment method. There will be only one element and element id is not significant.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Mandate type whether it is one-off or recurring.

String.name: PIN_FLD_IBAN
String.Doc: International Bank Account Number which is a unique identifier for the bank account.

String.name: PIN_FLD_BIC
String.Doc: Bank Identifier Code which is a unique identifier for the bank related to the account.

String.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_CONTRACT_ID
String.Doc: ID of the underlying contract between the debtor and the creditor.

String.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_CONTRACT_DESCR
String.Doc: Description of the underlying contract between the debtor and the creditor.

String.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_UNIQUE_REFERENCE
String.Doc: A unique reference number for the mandate.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_SIGNED_T
Timestamp.Doc: Date when the mandate is signed. This cannot be before the account creation date or a future date.

String.name: PIN_FLD_MANDATE_SIGNED_PLACE
String.Doc: Place where the mandate is signed.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_DEBTOR_INFO
Array.Doc: Array to store SEPA compliant customer's bank account details.

String.name: PIN_FLD_REF_PARTY
String.Doc: Name of the Debtor Reference Party.

String.name: PIN_FLD_REF_PARTY_ID_CODE
String.Doc: Identification code of the Debtor Reference Party.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO
Array.Doc: This represents the array of Billing info's specified.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The POID of billinfo.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BUSINESS_PROFILE_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Business profile poid. Pointer to the Business profile poid to which this billinfo belongs.

String.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO_ID
String.Doc: This field identifies the billinfo by name.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PAYINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The payinfo object that this billinfo is associated with.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_GRP_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The balance group object that this billinfo is associated with.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_PAY_TYPE
Enum.Doc: This represents the type of billing for user.

Values.Doc: Indicates charge roll up to parent account (PIN_PAY_TYPE_SUBORD)

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PARENT_FLAGS
Int.Doc: This field indicates if this billinfo has subordinates or not. The value of 0 indicates that it does not have subordinates and the value of 1 indicates that it has subordinates.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_BILL_WHEN
Int.Doc: Anniversary billing slot.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_ACTG_FUTURE_DOM
Int.Doc: New Accounting Close day-of-month (1-31).

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_ACTG_TYPE
Enum.Doc: Accounting type of the billinfo. Possible values are PIN_ACTG_TYPE_OPEN_ITEMS(1) and PIN_ACTG_TYPE_BALANCE_FORWARD(2).This field is used to allocate items for payment. If not specified, the configuration entry actg_type is read from pin.conf of CM. If CM's pin.conf does not have actg_type entry active, then default accounting type will be balance forward type.

Values.Doc: This represents "open items" type of accounting. With open item accounting customer's bill does not include amounts from previous bill, if not paid(PIN_ACTG_TYPE_OPEN_ITEMS).
This represents "balance forward" type of accounting. With balance forward accounting customer's bill will include amounts from previous bill, if not paid(PIN_ACTG_TYPE_BALANCE_FORWARD).

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_BILLING_STATUS
Enum.Doc: Indicates whether the billinfo should be billed or it should be suspended for billing.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_BILLING_STATUS_FLAGS
Int.Doc: Indicates a reason for setting of the given billing status.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS
Enum.Doc: Status of the billinfo: active, inactive, or closed.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS_FLAGS
Int.Doc: It indicates a reason for setting of the given status.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_SPONSOR_FLAGS
Int.Doc: It indicates whether this billinfo has a sponsoree.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_SPONSOREE_FLAGS
Int.Doc: It indicates whether this billinfo has a sponsor.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_AR_BILLINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: It indicates the AR billinfo for the given billinfo. It can be present only for a subodinate billinfo.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PARENT_BILLINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: It indicates the immediate (one level up) parent. Note that the given billinfo is not necessary a subordinate. The parent field may reflect just child-parent relation It should be mandatory if moving to the new parent.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CURRENCY
Int.Doc: Primary curreny.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CURRENCY_SECONDARY
Int.Doc: Secondary currency.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_BILLING_SEGMENT
Enum.Doc: It indicates the Billing Segment. The billing segment is a user defined category that controls accounting DOMs to which a bill unit can be assigned.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_EFFECTIVE_T
Timestamp.Doc: This field represents the timestamp of effective time of the update to this billinfo. If not specified, the current time on the BRM server will be used.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_TOPUP_INFO
Array.Doc: Topup array.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: Topup poid.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_ACCOUNT_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Account poid.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PAYINFO
Array.Doc: The element-id is significant. Contents are not significant. The element id points to the payinfo array element in the input flist to be used for top-up.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PAYINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The payinfo object that this topup is associated with. If PIN_FLD_PAYINFO is passed in, this field will be ignored. If PIN_FLD_PAYINFO is not passed in, this becomes a mandatory field.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO
Array.Doc: The element-id is significant. Contents are not significant. The element id points to the billinfo array element in the input flist to be used for top-up.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BILLINFO_OBJ
Poid.Doc: The POID of Billinfo that this topup is associated with. If PIN_FLD_BILLINFO is passed in, this field will be ignored. If PIN_FLD_BILLINFO is not passed in, this becomes a mandatory field.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_TOPUP_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Topup amount. In case of auto-topups this will indicate the amount to topup with.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_TOPUP_CAP
Decimal.Doc: Topup cap. This amount indicates the max topup that can be done for a given cycle. The cycle is driven by the cycle information set-up in the billinfo. A values of 0 means no cap.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_TOPPED_AMT
Decimal.Doc: This indicates the total topped up amount during the given cycle. This amount will be populated only if the cap is set.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_LAST_TOPUP_T
Timestamp.Doc: This indicates the when the last topup happened.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_GROUP_TOPUP_INFO
Array.Doc: The field represents sponsored topup. The array contains fields related to Sponsored topup only.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: The /group/topup poid. Poid of sponsored topup group involved in the creation/modification of member account.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_PARENT
Poid.Doc: Parent's account poid.

String.name: PIN_FLD_NAME
String.Doc: The Name of the /group/topup. This helps to identify the group.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_GRP_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Balance Group of the parent/payer of the /group/topup.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_GROUP_TOPUP_LIMITS
Array.Doc: Represents /group/topup financial properties per resource id.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_RESOURCE_ID
Int.Doc: Resource id of topup operation.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_TOPUP_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Topup amount is used in automatic sponsored topup.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_TOPUP_CAP
Decimal.Doc: Topup cap is used as a maximum limit of topup for particular topup group during cycle.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_GROUP_TOPUP_MEMBERS
Array.Doc: Represents members' properties of the /group/topup.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_INFO
Array.Doc: The member's topup balance group indicator. Here the array does not contain anything but the element id is significant. It indicates which balance group element in the input is for topup level.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_BAL_GRP_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Balance Group of a member of the /group/topup.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_TOPUP_INTERVAL
Int.Doc: This indicates the interval at which automatic sponsored topup occur.

String.name: PIN_FLD_PIN
String.Doc: The PIN which will be used for authentication during Ad-Hoc topup.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS
Enum.Doc: The status of the member (active/inactive/closed).

Array.name: PIN_FLD_FIELD
Array.Doc: This array will appear in the output only if there is an ebuf error.

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_FIELD_NUM
Enum.Doc: Field that failed.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_ELEMENT_ID
Int.Doc: Element-id of field that failed (if an array element).

Enum.name: PIN_FLD_RESULT
Enum.Doc: Field validation error code. The enumerated type is defined in the pin_cust.h header file. The values can be: (0) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_SYSTEM, (1) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_MISSING, (2) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_MIN_LEN, (3) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_MAX_LEN, (4) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_TYPE, (5) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_DUPE, (6) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_INVALID, (7) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_REJECT, (8) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_MAX, (9) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_MIN, (10) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_INCL, (11) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_EXCL, and (12) PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_FORMAT.

Values.Doc: PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_FORMAT. Format error in regular expression.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_FIELD
Array.Doc: For FIELDS array elements that do *not* contain a nested FIELDS array, the field that failed (as defined by PIN_FLD_FIELD_NUM) is included here on the flist. This field is MANDATORY in this case and its value represents either the bad value specified or a suggested replacement value for the field. In cases where this FIELDS element does contain a nested FIELDS array, the field defined by PIN_FLD_FIELD_NUM is *not* included in the output flist. For the following values of PIN_FLD_RESULT, the field value will be NULL: PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_MISSING. For the following values of PIN_FLD_RESULT, the field value contains the bad value that was specified: PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_MIN_LEN, PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_MAX_LEN, PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_FORMAT, PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_INVALID. For the following values of PIN_FLD_RESULT, the field value contains a suggested replacement value for the field: PIN_CUST_VAL_ERR_DUPE. If field that failed was in a sub-flist, the fields arrays are nested to provide an absolute path to the exact field that failed. This nesting can be to any depth to reflect multi-level sub-flists. NOTE: if more than one field on the same sub-flist failed validation, then more than one element of the FIELDS array will be included within the nesting to reflect the fields that failed. Nested Fields arrays have the same fields in each element as the main array.
